start.title: align-content: start
start.description: Both rows are packed at the top of the container. Remaining vertical space stays at the bottom.

center.title: align-content: center
center.description: The two rows are grouped together and centered vertically as a unit.

end.title: align-content: end
end.description: Both rows move to the bottom of the container, leaving empty space above.

between.title: align-content: space-between
between.description: The first row sticks to the top, the second row sticks to the bottom. Space exists only between rows.

around.title: align-content: space-around
around.description: Equal vertical space appears above the first row, between the rows, and below the second row.

stretch.title: align-content: stretch
stretch.description: Both rows stretch vertically to fill the container height, making each row taller.

challenge.title: Distribute Flex Rows
challenge.description: This challenge checks whether you understand how flex lines (rows) are distributed vertically.
challenge.targetDescription: One row should touch the top, the other should touch the bottom.
challenge.successMessage: Perfect! You correctly distributed the flex rows.
challenge.hintMessage: Think about which value pushes the first row up and the last row down.
challenge.baseContainer: flex flex-wrap border-2 border-gray-600 rounded-lg bg-gray-800/30 p-4 h-80 w-full
